instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00426: What is 820-00426? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1398: What is A1398? A1398 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2015, Mid 2012, Early 2013, Late 2013, Mid 2014 with EMC 2909, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00138, 820-00163, 820-00426, 820-3332, 820-3662, 820-3787..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Quick question, 

would a A1494 battery (made for 2014 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>) work on a <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2015 Retina. 

I ordered a A1494 battery instead of A1618 (couldn’t find any in the uk)  one and it works absolutely fine, just want to make sure it’s safe

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: No idea, isn't the area around the trackpad slightly different?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: I’ve always been using A1494 and A1493 instead of A1618 and A1582 without any issues.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Thanks for info. 

Is is there any reason why the sellers make it perfectly clear and warn you not to purchase it for a 2015 model?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: I don’t know. They have slightly different power ratings. So officially they are not interchangeable. I just haven’t had any issues doing it and I’ve had zero customers complaining about the battery life/issues after getting this swap. But who knows. Maybe there can be some rare issues associated whit this.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: I think it should be alright as long as it fits in the case. The battery will communicate about its needs to the SMC and most importantly the ISL so I don't see any reason why they won't be interchangeable
